headline: US applications for jobless benefits inch up last week to a still-low 200,000
summary: The number of Americans who applied for unemployment benefits inched up last week but U.S. layoffs remain historically low despite signs of a softening labor market.  U.S. filings for jobless aid for the week ending Jan. 17 rose by 1,000 to 200,000, up from 199,000 the previous week, the Labor Department reported Thursday.  Applications for unemployment benefits are viewed as a proxy for layoffs and are close to a real-time indicator of the health of the job market.
